definitions.definition: Land adjoining a non-flowing body of water, such as an ocean, lake or pond.
definitions.example: lake shore;  bay shore;  gulf shore;  island shore;  mainland shore;  river shore;  estuary shore;  pond shore;  sandy shore;  rocky shore

definitions.definition: (from the perspective of one on a body of water) Land, usually near a port.
definitions.example: The passengers signed up for shore tours.

definitions.definition: A prop or strut supporting the weight or flooring above it.
definitions.example: The shores stayed upright during the earthquake.

definitions.definition: (usually with up) To reinforce (something at risk of failure).
definitions.example: The workers were shoring up the dock after part of it fell into the water.
